subtitles.transcript: If you take the top two public universities in the U.S. - UCLA and UC Berkeley -
and you look at the number of students on Pell Grants, that’s more students just in number
than the Pell Grant students at the top 15 private colleges and universities: eight in the Ivy League
and then Chicago, Stanford, Hopkins, Washington U and a bunch of others. So if two is greater than 15,
what that does is to establish a different way to think about how being public might go along with tuition,
it might go along with, you know, revenue generation of a different kind,
but it still is about a level of openness that the private sector cannot provide.
